text:
:wave: Good morning, developers.  I wanted to bring your attention to two important product updates that were mentioned in developer day presentations, the ability to disable jQuery for CMS pages and our new Code Alerts tool.  We're moving these into a small beta today and we'd like to welcome you to participate.  To get your portal ungated for these updates send me a DM with the HubID and I'll get you added to the gates.

Remove HubSpot’s included jQuery library from CMS pages

What it is - This setting removes our standard jQuery library from your CMS pages which can help reduce page weight and improve page load speed.

How to use it - After turning jQuery off, pages should be tested to make sure they still look correct and have no new developer console errors in browsers. “$ is not defined” will shown in the console error log for any pages impacted.  JavaScript files from the Vast theme and clones of the Vast theme JavaScript files are most likely to experience issues.

<https://app.HubSpot.com/l/settings/website/pages/all-domains/page-templates>

Code Alerts

<http://app.HubSpot.com/l/code-alerts>  This can also be accessed via the sprocket menu > code alerts when viewing a published CMS page that you are currently authenticated to.

What it is - an overview of CMS hosted pages, templates and modules that are using HubL functions more than the recommended times..

How to use it - This tool highlights pages that are using roughly 20 HubL function tags repeatedly in the same page, template or module.. Calling these functions more than 10 times per the page is likely to create performance issues for the website visitor.  We recommend reviewing pages and looking for more efficient ways to fetch / store returned data to be served on user interaction.  This tool includes deep linking to templates and modules where the functions were detected.  You can find more information regarding our recommended limits here: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/-temporary-slug-bc4b6f4d-e22e-497f-8e15-329e77cc8a98?hs_preview=gaETmzGD-9565893824>
so now that this option exists… I would like to extend a virtual hug to whoever made this possible
cc <@UAHMP10RH> - this is what we were talking about earlier today :slightly_smiling_face:
For those interested in having the *Remove jQuery* option added to a portal, please fill out the form located here: <https://forms.gle/oTXVoJvBhFiJC1qC8>
For those interested in having the *Code Alerts* option added to a portal, please fill out this form: <https://forms.gle/pSfGq7Ejo7Um4mK96>

Is is possible to get on a dev portal and a production portal. I am going to be building out a site on a dev portal and moving to a client portal probably q1. This would be a great opportunity to test these features out
For you no, anyone else can though :slightly_smiling_face:
absolutely lol, just fill in the form twice :slightly_smiling_face:
